channel.title: Help! JAVA is not recognised
channel.description:
So i've DLed the clients i want to play but the client opens and says "JAVA is not recognised as an external or internal command, operable program or batch file" what do i do i have the latest version of JAVA and this is happening multiple times on different clients :( so if you can please help me, as it could be a problem with the path in my envioroment variables that i don't know how to fix
things i've tried so far:- Uninstalling all JAVA files and installing them again

item.title: Help! JAVA is not recognised
item.dc:creator: @Snoww Snoww
item.description:
@Snoww wrote:

19spartan94:

DUDE U ROCK!!! i had 2 reinstall windows and it fucked my server up and now i can run it yaay!!!

I lol’d.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! JAVA is not recognised
item.dc:creator: @mr_pker01 mr pker01
item.description:
@mr_pker01 wrote:

for classpath is: C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
for path is: C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin;
then ur java is now recognized

Read full topic

item.title: Help! JAVA is not recognised
item.dc:creator: @19spartan94 19spartan94
item.description:
@19spartan94 wrote:

[quote=“spiky27, post:2, topic:223911”]ok, if you have java 6u6, then go to my compter-properties-advanced-enviroment variables-then in the CLASSPATH put-

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

then for PATH put-

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

they should both be under system variables click edit and replace old code with the codes above. gl[/quote]

DUDE U ROCK!!! i had 2 reinstall windows and it fucked my server up and now i can run it yaay!!!

Read full topic

yeah, just set correct variables.

item.description:
@Ibehustlin247 wrote:

Yes you do change the 06 to 07

item.title: Help! JAVA is not recognised
item.dc:creator: @ninjabait ninjabait
item.description:
@ninjabait wrote:

[quote=“spiky27, post:2, topic:223911”]ok, if you have java 6u6, then go to my compter-properties-advanced-enviroment variables-then in the CLASSPATH put-

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

then for PATH put-

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

they should both be under system variables click edit and replace old code with the codes above. gl[/quote]

ok but what if i have JDK 6.7 do i just change the _06 to _07[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 06, 2008, 09:30:30 pm[/size][hr]okay so i changed path and class path but instead of jdk C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin; i put C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;
as thats the one i use i done exactly the same with CLASSPATH just changed last 6 to a 7 but still not getting recognised

Read full topic

item.title: Help! JAVA is not recognised
item.dc:creator: @spiky27 spiky27
item.description:
@spiky27 wrote:

ok, if you have java 6u6, then go to my compter-properties-advanced-enviroment variables-then in the CLASSPATH put-

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

then for PATH put-

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

they should both be under system variables click edit and replace old code with the codes above. gl

Read full topic
